alert.note: Alert for Louisa (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 05 at 10:13PM CDT until July 06 at 12:00AM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1045 PM CDT FOR HENRY...VAN BUREN...WEST CENTRAL LOUISA...SOUTHEASTERN WASHINGTON...SOUTHEASTERN JEFFERSON...NORTHWESTERN LEE...SCOTLAND AND WESTERN CLARK COUNTIES... At 1012 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Mount Pleasant to near Lake Sugema Campground to 6 miles southwest of Downing, moving south at 65 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Mount Pleasant, Kahoka, Memphis, Keosauqua, New London, Winfield, West Point, Donnellson, Birmingham, Milton, Bonaparte, Salem, Stockport, Lockridge, Crawfordsville, Olds, Wyaconda, Cantril, Hillsboro and Franklin. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: Wind damage with these storms will occur before any rain or lightning. Do not wait for the sound of thunder before taking cover. SEEK SHELTER IMMEDIATELY inside a sturdy structure and stay away from windows.
